mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Monroe, James, 1758-1831
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Discusses mismanagement of his private affairs and plantation during his absence; duties in Washington keep his mind absorbed; mentions a minister sailing for France (Mr. G?), one for Russia, Mr. Pinkey nominated for special mission to Naples was turned down by Senate, one for Spain, Mr. Erving. Autograph Letter Signed.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Jay Johns Collection of James Monroe Papers
mdRecord.dcterms:title: James Monroe, Washington, to Charles Everett, 1816 March 10
